etymology.description: 利(lì) + 尔(ěr) = approximates the foreign ending “-real/-riel”.
etymology.interpretation: Used as a phonetic chunk in transliterations to render the syllable sequence -real/-riel, especially in names, e.g., 蒙特利尔 for Montréal. It carries no independent meaning outside such proper names.
etymology.simplification: “爾” was simplified to “尔” by reducing strokes and components in the character; 利 remained unchanged.

parts.english: phonetic ending -real/-riel; transliteration chunk; no inherent meaning
